questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A developer must create a Bash script that performs a Chef Client reload in the event of a system reset. Which command completes the script?

choices.A: Provide and consume a permit any contract on the VRF level.
choices.C: Place all EPGs in the preferred group.
choices.B: Create a VRF in the common tenant.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
vzAny contract to VRF or VRF in mode unenforced no?

Selected Answer: A
C would mean changing VRF configration. So A is the correct one,

Selected Answer: A
You would need to assign an EPG to a Preffered group so that rules C out.

Selected Answer: C
The Preferred Group (PG) feature allows you to specify a set of EPGs that are part of the same VRF to allow full communication between them with no need for contracts to be created.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/mso/3x/configuration/cisco-aci-multi-site-configuration-guide-301/aci-multi-site-use-case-preferred-group.pdf

As the VRF is already created and all EPGs are in same VRF; preferred group will permit communication without the need of additional config

Selected Answer: A
A requires no additional configuration on EPG level. 

There are several different configuration options available to enable open communication amongst many/all EPGs on a Cisco ACI fabric:

● Contract with vzAny: vzAny represents all EPGs, ESGs and external EPGs on a VRF instance. Providing and consuming an open "permit-any" contract on vzAny allows open communication between all endpoints on a VRF instance.

● Preferred Groups – Assigning multiple EPGs to a Preferred Group allows open communication between the EPGs in the Preferred Group, with the restriction that there can only be one Preferred Group per VRF instance.

● Disable security – We do not recommend this option because configuring the VRF instance to "unenforced" mode converts the VRF instance to "permit only," allowing open communication between all endpoints in the VRF instance. Disabling security implicitly disables security contracts and advanced functionality such as service graphs.

Selected Answer: C
only preferred group does not require additional configuration

questions.question_text: An engineer must implement a new VRF that permits communication between all endpoint groups (EPGs) by default. The new EPGs and bridge domains (BDs) that are created in the new VRF must not require additional configuration to permit traffic between the newly created EPGs or BDs. Which action accomplishes this goal?

choices.C: Create two traffic monitoring sessions with different names, one per fabric. Connect the analyzer connected to FI-B as the destination for both monitoring sessions.
choices.B: Create two traffic monitoring sessions with the same name, one per fabric. Connect the analyzer connected to FI-A as the destination for both monitoring sessions.
choices.D: Create two traffic monitoring sessions with the same name, one per fabric. Connect an analyzer on each FI as the destination for the monitoring session local to that FI.
choices.A: Create two traffic monitoring sessions with different names, one per fabric. Connect an analyzer on each FI as the destination for the monitoring session local to the FI.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Add the vNIC as the traffic source using the exact same name for both sessions.
i think A

D

Because a traffic monitoring destination is a single physical port, a traffic monitoring session can monitor only a single fabric. To monitor uninterrupted vNIC traffic across a fabric failover, create two sessions, one per fabric and connect two analyzers. Add the vNIC as the traffic source using the exact same name for both sessions.

Because a traffic monitoring destination is a single physical port, a traffic monitoring session can monitor only a single fabric. To monitor uninterrupted vNIC traffic across a fabric failover, create two sessions, one per fabric and connect two analyzers. Add the vNIC as the traffic source using the exact same name for both sessions.

Answer: D

Selected Answer: D
D is correct!

Selected Answer: D
Because a traffic monitoring destination is a single physical port, a traffic monitoring session can monitor only a single fabric. To monitor uninterrupted vNIC traffic across a fabric failover, create two sessions, one per fabric and connect two analyzers. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/System-Monitoring/3-1/b_UCSM_CLI_System_Monitoring_Guide_3_1/b_UCSM_CLI_System_Monitoring_Guide_3_1_chapter_01101.html

Add the vNIC as the traffic source using the exact same name for both sessions.

questions.question_text: An engineer is implementing traffic monitoring for a server vNIC that is configured with fabric failover enabled. The requirement is for the traffic to be sent to an analyzer, even during a failure of one of the fabric interconnects. The analyzer is connected to unconfigured Ethernet ports on both fabric interconnects. Which configuration accomplishes this task?

choices.C: UCS-A# scope fc-storage UCS-A/fc-storage# create vsan VSAN10 10 20 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan # create member-port fcoe a 1 2 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan/member-port* # commit-buffer
choices.A: UCS-A# scope eth-storage UCS-A/fc-storage# create vsan VSAN10 10 20 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan # create member-port fcoe a 2 1 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan/member-port* # commit-buffer
choices.D: UCS-A# scope fc-uplink UCS-A/fc-storage# create vsan VSAN10 20 10 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan # create member-port fcoe a 1 2 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan/member-port* # commit-buffer
choices.B: UCS-A# scope fc-traffic-mon UCS-A/fc-storage# create vsan VSAN10 20 10 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan # create member-port fcoe a 2 1 UCS-A/fc-storage/vsan/member-port* # commit-buffer

questions.question_text:
An engineer must configure a named VSAN when the fabric interconnect is in Fibre Channel switch mode. The VSAN must meet these requirements:
✑ Named VSAN must be called `VSAN10`.
✑ VSAN ID must be 10.
✑ FCoE ID must be 20.
✑ VSAN 10 must be attached to port 2 in slot 1.
Which command set configures a VSAN when the fabric interconnects is in Fibre Channel switch mode?
